meanings.def: (5th or 6th century) a king of England who led the Britons in battles against the Saxons. There are many stories about King Arthur, e.g. that he pulled his sword Excalibur from a stone, and that he sat with his knights at a Round Table. Nobody knows if the stories are true, but they are very popular and have been used in poems, plays and films.
the male ruler of an independent state that has a royal family
examples: the kings and queens of England
He died bravely, serving his king.
He was crowned king at the age of fifteen.
The kings of Sicily also ruled over the southern part of Italy.
Charles remained a close ally to the French king throughout his reign.
His daughter, Anne, married King Richard III.

meanings.def: a person, an animal or a thing that is thought to be the best or most important of a particular type
examples: The lion is the king of the jungle.
He is the undisputed king of talk shows.

meanings.def: used in compounds with the names of animals or plants to describe a very large type of the thing mentioned
the most important piece used in the game of chess, that can move one square in any direction
a playing card with the picture of a king on it
a very large amount of money
the person considered to be the best, most famous or successful in a particular place or area of activity
